title: This is where Jurgen Klopp makes team talks - take a look inside new Liverpool dressing room at Anfield

Take a look at Anfield's new home dressing room - where the likes of Roberto Firmino , Philippe Coutinho and Sadio Mane will get ready for the Merseyside Derby. 
Jurgen Klopp will be giving his Liverpool team talk in a new surrounding when Everton visit Anfield on Saturday lunchtime. 
Along with plenty of space to get changed and do a couple of pre-match stretches, there is a fully-equipped warm-up area and a treatment room with top of the range 4G artificial turf. The room keeps with Anfield's surroundings (Photo: Andrew Powell/Liverpool FC via Getty Images) The Reds will use the room for the first time against Everton (Photo: Andrew Powell/Liverpool FC via Getty Images) The room is incredibly classy (Photo: Andrew Powell/Liverpool FC via Getty Images) 
The decor has been kept in style with the historic Anfield stadium with a classy wooden finish. 
The whole room is an explosion of red with each player getting a specially placed peg and bench. 
They also feature USB and power points with personalised removable name panels - in case of a quick transfer. Simon Mignolet's personalised space (Photo: Andrew Powell/Liverpool FC via Getty Images) Each space has a USB and power points (Photo: Andrew Powell/Liverpool FC via Getty Images) The extra comfort could help the Reds to Champions League places (Photo: Andrew Powell/Liverpool FC via Getty Images) 
The Reds' ground is slowly being renovated with the Main Stand being rebuilt last summer, with the Kop being slightly extended. 
There are still potential plans for an Anfield Road End redevelopment - with a new club shop and other interior improvements being made. 
Liverpool host the 228th Merseyside Derby this week - but will be without Adam Lallana, Jordan Henderson and Daniel Sturridge. poll loading Will the new dressing room help Liverpool beat Everton? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
